title: Danniella Westbrook puts on a brave face after drug relapse for Loose Women interview with son Kai
text:
Danniella Westbrook puts on a brave face after drug relapse for Loose Women interview with son Kai The former EastEnders actress almost had a spring in her step... Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
She is no stranger to sharing her salacious - and often frustrating - story on teleivision. 
So it makes perfect sense that Danniella Westbrook was spotted at the ITV studios in central London on Monday, where she's due to discuss her recent drug relapse on Loose Women. 
The 43 year-old was seen with her son, Kai, at the chat show's Southbank set and seemed in surprisingly high spirits. Danniella Westbrook and her son outside ITV Studios on Monday (Photo: WENN.com) The pair braced themselves for the tell-all chat (Photo: WENN.com) 
Wearing a pair of skinny jeans with a polo neck jumper and a faux fur waistcoat, she was all smiles as she greeted onlookers with a broad grin. 
Clutching a designer handbag, the former EastEnders actress kept close to her son, who seemed to be a little less comfortable in the limelight. 
Keeping his head down and hiding under a beanie hat, he may have been apprehensive about his pending TV appearance - and its sensitive subject matter. The former drug addict is speaking about her recent relapse (Photo: WENN.com) 
Yesterday, Danniella took to Twitter to share a rather optimistic post, saying: "I've woken up on cloud nine. A change of mood a change of heart and positivity in abundance. 
"Have a lot to be grateful about." 
Her interview comes just days after she showed off the horrifying results of a recent botched dental job after a case of life-threatening septicaemia. Wearing a pair of skinny jeans with a polo neck jumper and a faux fur waistcoat, she was all smiles (Photo: WENN.com) 
The actress previously revealed the mouth infection and resulting dental work which left her with a face that was "caving in" led her to relapse in a bid to numb her pain. 
â€œI did relapse, I thought my whole world was over when [George] walked out," she told This Morning last November. 
While speaking to Now magazine , this week, she added: "Everything was going so well. It was supposed to be my year, but then the teeth implants didn't take and I became so low." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
